t: Luke 21
The Widow’s Offering
Jesus*p looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts into the offering box,
and he saw a poor widow put in two small copper coins.
And he said, “Truly,*r I*r tell*r you,*r this*r poor*r widow*r has*r put*r in*r more*r than*r all*r of*r them.*r
For*r they*r all*r contributed*r out*r of*r their*r abundance,*r but*r she*r out*r of*r her*r poverty*r put*r in*r all*r she*r had*r to*r live*r on.”*r
Jesus Foretells Destruction of the Temple
And*p while some were speaking of the temple, how it was adorned with noble stones and offerings, he said,
“As*r for*r these*r things*r that*r you*r see,*r the*r days*r will*r come*r when*r there*r will*r not*r be*r left*r here*r one*r stone*r upon*r another*r that*r will*r not*r be*r thrown*r down.”*r
And they asked him, “Teacher, when will these things be, and what will be the sign when these things are about to take place?”

And he said, “See*r that*r you*r are*r not*r led*r astray.*r For*r many*r will*r come*r in*r my*r name,*r saying,*r ‘I*r am*r he!’*r and,*r ‘The*r time*r is*r at*r hand!’*r Do*r not*r go*r after*r them.*r
And*r when*r you*r hear*r of*r wars*r and*r tumults,*r do*r not*r be*r terrified,*r for*r these*r things*r must*r first*r take*r place,*r but*r the*r end*r will*r not*r be*r at*r once.”*r
Jesus Foretells Wars and Persecution
Then*p he said to them, “Nation*r will*r rise*r against*r nation,*r and*r kingdom*r against*r kingdom.*r
There*r will*r be*r great*r earthquakes,*r and*r in*r various*r places*r famines*r and*r pestilences.*r And*r there*r will*r be*r terrors*r and*r great*r signs*r from*r heaven.*r

But*r before*r all*r this*r they*r will*r lay*r their*r hands*r on*r you*r and*r persecute*r you,*r delivering*r you*r up*r to*r the*r synagogues*r and*r prisons,*r and*r you*r will*r be*r brought*r before*r kings*r and*r governors*r for*r my*r name’s*r sake.*r
This*r will*r be*r your*r opportunity*r to*r bear*r witness.*r
Settle*r it*r therefore*r in*r your*r minds*r not*r to*r meditate*r beforehand*r how*r to*r answer,*r
for*r I*r will*r give*r you*r a*r mouth*r and*r wisdom,*r which*r none*r of*r your*r adversaries*r will*r be*r able*r to*r withstand*r or*r contradict.*r
You*r will*r be*r delivered*r up*r even*r by*r parents*r and*r brothers*r and*r relatives*r and*r friends,*r and*r some*r of*r you*r they*r will*r put*r to*r death.*r
You*r will*r be*r hated*r by*r all*r for*r my*r name’s*r sake.*r
But*r not*r a*r hair*r of*r your*r head*r will*r perish.*r
By*r your*r endurance*r you*r will*r gain*r your*r lives.*r
Jesus Foretells Destruction of Jerusalem
“But*rp when*r you*r see*r Jerusalem*r surrounded*r by*r armies,*r then*r know*r that*r its*r desolation*r has*r come*r near.*r

Then*r let*r those*r who*r are*r in*r Judea*r flee*r to*r the*r mountains,*r and*r let*r those*r who*r are*r inside*r the*r city*r depart,*r and*r let*r not*r those*r who*r are*r out*r in*r the*r country*r enter*r it,*r
for*r these*r are*r days*r of*r vengeance,*r to*r fulfill*r all*r that*r is*r written.*r

Alas*r for*r women*r who*r are*r pregnant*r and*r for*r those*r who*r are*r nursing*r infants*r in*r those*r days!*r For*r there*r will*r be*r great*r distress*r upon*r the*r earth*r and*r wrath*r against*r this*r people.*r

They*r will*r fall*r by*r the*r edge*r of*r the*r sword*r and*r be*r led*r captive*r among*r all*r nations,*r and*r Jerusalem*r will*r be*r trampled*r underfoot*r by*r the*r Gentiles,*r until*r the*r times*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r are*r fulfilled.*r
The Coming of the Son of Man

“And*rp there*r will*r be*r signs*r in*r sun*r and*r moon*r and*r stars,*r and*r on*r the*r earth*r distress*r of*r nations*r in*r perplexity*r because*r of*r the*r roaring*r of*r the*r sea*r and*r the*r waves,*r
people*r fainting*r with*r fear*r and*r with*r foreboding*r of*r what*r is*r coming*r on*r the*r world.*r For*r the*r powers*r of*r the*r heavens*r will*r be*r shaken.*r
And*r then*r they*r will*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r coming*r in*r a*r cloud*r with*r power*r and*r great*r glory.*r
Now*r when*r these*r things*r begin*r to*r take*r place,*r straighten*r up*r and*r raise*r your*r heads,*r because*r your*r redemption*r is*r drawing*r near.”*r
The Lesson of the Fig Tree
And*p he told them a parable: “Look*r at*r the*r fig*r tree,*r and*r all*r the*r trees.*r
As*r soon*r as*r they*r come*r out*r in*r leaf,*r you*r see*r for*r yourselves*r and*r know*r that*r the*r summer*r is*r already*r near.*r
So*r also,*r when*r you*r see*r these*r things*r taking*r place,*r you*r know*r that*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r near.*r
Truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r this*r generation*r will*r not*r pass*r away*r until*r all*r has*r taken*r place.*r
Heaven*r and*r earth*r will*r pass*r away,*r but*r my*r words*r will*r not*r pass*r away.*r
Watch Yourselves

“But*rp watch*r yourselves*r lest*r your*r hearts*r be*r weighed*r down*r with*r dissipation*r and*r drunkenness*r and*r cares*r of*r this*r life,*r and*r that*r day*r come*r upon*r you*r suddenly*r like*r a*r trap.*r
For*r it*r will*r come*r upon*r all*r who*r dwell*r on*r the*r face*r of*r the*r whole*r earth.*r

But*r stay*r awake*r at*r all*r times,*r praying*r that*r you*r may*r have*r strength*r to*r escape*r all*r these*r things*r that*r are*r going*r to*r take*r place,*r and*r to*r stand*r before*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.”*r
And*p every day he was teaching in the temple, but at night he went out and lodged on the mount called Olivet.
And early in the morning all the people came to him in the temple to hear him.
